summary: This document contains two affidavits signed by Ghislaine Maxwell in December 2020, waiving her rights to contest extradition from the United Kingdom and France to the United States. The waivers are conditional on her release on bail and are intended to be used by the US government if she violates bail conditions. The affidavits were sworn before Judge Alison J. Nathan.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell holds citizenship in the United States, the United Kingdom, and France.
Maxwell has resided in the United States since approximately 1991 and was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, New York, as of December 2020.
The waivers are conditional on her release on bail and are designed to be used by the US government to expedite extradition if she violates bail conditions.
The document reveals Maxwell's legal strategy to potentially secure bail by preemptively waiving extradition challenges from two countries.
The affidavits were sworn before Judge Alison J. Nathan of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.
